title: Michael Bolton reveals he was diagnosed with brain tumor; had immediate surgery to remove it
text: Michael Bolton reveals he was diagnosed with brain tumor; had it removed before the holidays Singer Michael Bolton recently revealed he was diagnosed with a brain tumor, which required emergency surgery just before the holidays. The Grammy Award-winning artist [announced on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/michaelbolton/posts/pfbid0XxomipRfNMBD3b4MzgLr9tzPiVebvaE7EtZfh99cs76FNVjodVkKSXx2Mv5Lq81el) Friday afternoon that the surgery was successful. "Thanks to my incredible medical team, the surgery was a success. I am now recuperating at home and surrounded by the tremendous love and support of my family," Bolton said. He went on to say that he will spend the next few months focusing on his recovery, which will force him to take a break from touring. The 70-year-old singer was scheduled to perform in Clearwater, Florida, on Feb. 1. "It is always the hardest thing for me to ever disappoint my fans or postpone a show, but have no doubt I am working hard to accelerate my recovery and get back to performing soon," Bolton said. "I am beyond grateful for all the love and support you have so generously shown me through the years." In addition to his two Grammy awards, Bolton has won six American Music Awards and has topped the Billboard charts with hits "How Am I Supposed to Live Without You," and "When A Man Loves A Woman."
